html:
394 U.S. 720

89 S.Ct. 1473

22 L.Ed.2d 675

Willie T. JONES
v.
FLORIDA.

No. 807, Misc.

Supreme Court of the United States

April 21, 1969

Phillip A. Hubbart, for petitioner.

Earl Faircloth, Atty. Gen. of Florida, and Harold Mendelow, Asst. Atty. Gen., for respondent.

On Petition for Writ of Certiorari to the District Court of Appeal of Florida, Third District.

PER CURIAM.

1

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the District Court of Appeal of Florida, Third District, for further consideration in light of Bruton v. United States, 391 U.S. 123, 88 S.Ct. 1620, 20 L.Ed.2d 476, and Roberts v. Russell, 392 U.S. 293, 88 S.Ct. 1921, 20 L.Ed.2d 1100.

PER CURIAM.

The motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis and the petition for a writ of certiorari are granted. The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the District Court of Appeal of Florida, Third District, for further consideration in light of Bruton v. United States, 391 U. S. 123, and Roberts v. Russell, 392 U. S. 293.
